2. unzip eclipse-RCP-3.3M7-delta-pack.zip
3. use update manager on EUROPA site

I am experiencing something similar. 

My system:

eclipse.buildId=I20070503-1400
java.version=1.6.0_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -startup /home/della/programs/eclipse3.3/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070502.jar
Command-line arguments:  -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86 -startup /home/della/programs/eclipse3.3/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070502.jar

I have installed some plugins via update managers and everything worked. 
Now when I try to install J2EE tools and Web Tools from Europa Update Site there is always this error:

An internal error occurred during: "Update Manager".

java.lang.ClassFormatError: org/eclipse/update/internal/jarprocessor/Utils
at org.eclipse.update.internal.jarprocessor.UnpackStep.canUnpack(UnpackStep.java:31)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.jarprocessor.JarProcessor.canPerformUnpack(JarProcessor.java:50)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FeaturePackagedContentProvider.retrieveLocalJar(FeaturePackagedContentProvider.java:188)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FeaturePackagedContentProvider.getPluginEntryArchiveReferences(FeaturePackagedContentProvider.java:179)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.operations.UpdateUtils.downloadFeatureContent(UpdateUtils.java:628)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2.download(InstallWizard2.java:426)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2.access$3(InstallWizard2.java:397)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2$3.run(InstallWizard2.java:350)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

I have so far tried to install from every Eclipse milestone release (including RC0) and I ALWAYS fail to install from the Europa update-site

Does ANYONE at eclipse care about that the update-site is broken?
How do you expect people to test your milestones if they can not even install them?

1. tar -xvzf /opt2/tars/eclipse-3.3/eclipse-SDK-3.3RC1-linux-gtk.tar.gz
2. unzip /opt2/tars/eclipse-3.3/eclipse-RCP-3.3RC1-delta-pack.zip
3. use update manager on EUROPA site

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 8 1 2007-05-21 17:21:53.888
!MESSAGE
Lohar, as you can see from the error, a GMF plug-in is missing on the update site. Update Manager is not responsible for invalid update sites.

please reassign the bug to whatever component(s) you see fit.

As you can see with I20070503-1400 the problem was a internal zip error, now it's a missing plugin. I don't so much care about what's causing the problem as long as it get's fixed and one can use update manager to install Europa features.

As far as I as a user is concerned if the update via the update manager is broken I file it against update manager. It's not my job to figure out what's the cause under the hood.

Personally I think this update manager problem seriously hurts Eclipses reputation. With Callisto I could track the milestones and test them early on (I think I used M3 and later). With Europa I have been unsuccessfully trying for a long time (before I even started filing this bug) and I consider it a big setback that as of a RC release I still can not install from the Europa update site.
Nick Boldt just tested the GMF stack with RC2 and everything works.

traces.message: Server returned HTTP response code: "404 Not Found" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/releases/europa/plugins/org.eclipse.gmf.sdk_1.0.0.v20070403-1500.jar.
